intro: Tridesmostemon, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Tridesmostemon is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
